body:
I think they'll be picked up as-is.

There's little chance of that, anyway, since the value that's going to 
be written is a path that will be validated first.

-Mat

On 11/22/16 15:25, Tim Cartwright wrote:

> _@osg-cat_ commented on this pull request.
> 
> ---
> 
> In osg_configure/configure_modules/gratia.py
> https://github.com/opensciencegrid/osg-configure/pull/40#pullrequestreview-9761048:
> 
> > ```
> >      else:
> > ```
> > -            value = value.replace('"', '\"')
> > -            # urCollector.conf files are a custom format that require '"'
> > -            # surrounding the value but support no escaping of quotes or
> > -            # anything.
> > -            quoted_value = '"' + value + '"'
> 
> So what if value contains double quotes?
>
